ingredients.name: Chicken breast, boneless, skinless (cut into 1-inch cubes)

meals.name: Keto Grilled Pesto Chicken and Tomato Kebabs
meals.instruction:
1. In a food processor pulse basil, garlic, parmesan
cheese, salt and pepper until smooth. Slowly add the
olive oil while pulsing. Reserve 2-3 tbsp pesto in a
separate bowl.
2. Combine the raw chicken with the rest of the pesto
and marinate a few hours in a bowl.
3. Soak wooden skewers in water at least 30 minutes
(or use metal ones to avoid this step).
4. Beginning and ending with chicken, thread chicken
and tomatoes onto 8 pairs of parallel skewers to
make 8 kebabs total.
5. Heat the outdoor grill or indoor grill pan over
medium heat until hot. Be sure the grates are clean
and spray lightly with oil.
6. Place the chicken on the hot grill and cook about 3-4
minutes. Turn and continue cooking until chicken is
cooked through, about 2 to 3 minutes. Brush with
the reserved pesto.

meals.name: Hormone Balancing Granola
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 180�F.
Chop Brazil nuts and pecans in a food processor. Mix in a
bowl with all the other nuts, seeds, and coconut flakes.
Combine melted coconut oil, maple syrup, vanilla extract,
and cinnamon. Pour into the dry ingredients and mix until
everything is well-coated.
Place in the oven to cook for 30 minutes.

ingredients.name: Red currant (or raisins or other dried fruit)

meals.name: Best Lentil Salad Ever
meals.instruction:
1. Rinse lentils well, drain. Place in a pot and cover
with a 3-4 inches of water, bring to a boil, reduce to
simmer. Check lentils for doneness after 15 minutes,
but they should take about 20 minutes in total. You
will know they are cooked if they still retain a slight
tooth � al dente! Overcooking the lentils is the death
of this dish. Be careful!
2. While the lentils are simmering, make the dressing
by placing all ingredients in a jar with a tight fitting
lid and shake vigorously to combine.
3. Finely dice red onion � the salad is best if all the
ingredients are about the same size. If using raisins,
chop them roughly to make them a bit smaller, and
do the same with the capers if they are large.
4. When the lentils are cooked, remove from heat,
drain and place under cold running water to stop the
cooking process. Once cooled slightly, but still a
little warm, place lentils in a large serving bowl and
toss with dressing. Add onion, capers, and currants.

Optional add-ins: arugula, walnuts, goat cheese, fresh
herbs (flat-leaf parsley, cilantro, basil), sprouts, or crispy
seasonal veggies.
If using other add-ins, add them just before serving.

meals.name: Gluten-Free Avocado Toast
meals.instruction:
Toast bread slices. Slice a ripe avocado in half. 
Squeeze the meat of the avocado onto the toasted bread
and spread it evenly.
Cut a lime in half and gently squeeze the juice over the
avocado on your slices of toast.
Sprinkle red pepper flakes, sea salt, and black pepper to
taste.
Enjoy!

meals.name: Crazy Bean Chili
meals.instruction:
Toast cumin seeds in dry soup pot on medium heat, for 2 minutes until the aroma is strong. (This process releases the full flavour of
the spice).
Add the olive oil, onion, garlic, and jalape�o. Stir consistently until the onion is golden and translucent.
Add in the chili powder, tempeh (or mushrooms), zucchini, and potato, and stir well. Saut� for 3 to 4 minutes, stirring to avoid
sticking.
Add in black beans, kidney beans, tomatoes, water, maple syrup, sea salt, and cilantro. Cover with a lid, reduce heat to low, and
cook for 20�25 minutes, or until potatoes are tender.
Remove from heat, and stir in the kale. 
Serve hot. Garnish with diced avocado and cilantro, if using.
Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Atlantic salmon, wild (cut into 6 pieces or 1 large piece)

meals.name: Salmon with Avocado Salsa Oven Baked
meals.instruction:
Pre-heat the oven to 400 degrees.
Mix the cumin, paprika, garlic powder, black pepper, and
a 1/4 pinch of sea salt.
Coat the salmon with olive oil, the seasoning mix, and the
sliced onions.
Next, cover the pan with a glass lid (parchment paper and
then aluminum foil on top, so the toxins from the aluminum
don't go in the fish).
Place in the oven and cook until done, about 15-20 minutes
depending on the thickness of the fish.
Avocado Salsa
Combine the avocado, onion*, cilantro, lime juice, and 1/2
pinch of sea salt in a bowl and mix well,
Raw onion can be hard to digest. If you are healing
your gut either sautee or steam the onion or leave them
out.
Top the cooked salmon with avocado salsa and enjoy!

meals.name: Green Beans with Walnuts and Onions
meals.instruction:
Cut off green beans ends, boil green beans 3-4 minutes. 
In a large skillet, heat half of the olive oil over medium heat
and cook onions, stirring, for 5 minutes. Add walnuts and
garlic and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes.
Add the remaining oil and green beans. Season with salt
and pepper, stir and cook for 2 minutes.
Serve as an appetizer or with parboiled rice to make a
complete meal.

ingredients.name: Maple syrup (or sweetener of your choice)

meals.name: Chia Fresca
meals.instruction:
Place chia and water in a large mason and shake vigorously.
Add remaining ingredients and shake again. Let sit for 10
min. Shake vigorously again to remove any clumps (this is
normal) and enjoy! 
Pro tip: with stress comes inflammation in the body. This
can aggravate fatigue and cause aches and pains. Try
adding a scoop of clean bone broth protein OR collagen
peptides to your Chia water. It is flavorless and a potent
anti-inflammatory. Superfoods for the win!

ingredients.name: Almond milk, unsweetened, Blue Diamond (or brand of choice)

meals.name: Overnight PB&J Oats
meals.instruction:
In a small canning jar (or glass container with a lid), mix the
oats, almond milk, peanut butter and chia seeds until well
combined. Gently stir in strawberries. Cover and refrigerate
overnight.
Top with 1-2 tablespoons of almond milk before eating if you
like a looser consistency.
Note:
Oats are a great source of dietary fiber, potassium and iron.
If you haven�t given overnight oats a try yet, you are
missing out. This oatmeal is super satisfying and
reminiscent of a peanut butter and jelly sandwich.

ingredients.name: Chicken thighs, with skin (Organic if available)

meals.name: Smoked Paprika & Turmeric Roast Chicken Thighs
meals.instruction:
Make marinade: Add olive oil, lime juice, ginger, turmeric,
garlic, smoked paprika, salt and sumac and whisk until
everything is combined.
Wash chicken and pat dry and put in a Ziploc bag, add all of
the marinade, close bag and massage until every piece of
chicken is covered with the marinade. Put chicken in the
fridge and let marinate for at least 24 hours.
Next day:
Pre-heat oven to 350�F and line a deep baking dish with
parchment paper. Pour the chicken plus marinade into the
baking sheet and bake for 2 hours
uncovered. When cooked remove from baking dish and put
on a serving platter, drizzle some of the pan juices on the
chicken thighs & and serve with your side of choice such as
Quinoa OR Rice�..YUMMY

meals.name: Avocado & Hummus Topped Rice Cakes
meals.instruction:
Spread hummus over 4 cakes
Divide avocado in half by running a sharp knife around the
outside (length-wise) and remove the pit
Scoop avocado out and slice thinly placing equal amounts
on each rice cake
Sprinkle with fresh basil and serve

meals.name: Avocado & Hummus Topped Rice Cakes
meals.instruction:
Spread hummus over 4 cakes
Divide avocado in half by running a sharp knife around the
outside (length-wise) and remove the pit
Scoop avocado out and slice thinly placing equal amounts
on each rice cake
Sprinkle with fresh basil and serve

meals.name: Omega-3 Maple Almond Butter
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees and line a baking sheet with
parchment paper.
Toss almonds with maple syrup, to coat, and spread in an
even layer on lined baking sheet.
Roast in oven 10 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool.
Place roasted almonds, flax, chia, and hemp seeds in the
bowl of a food processor and process until smooth and the
oils have released. Add in coconut oil, cinnamon, and salt.
Process until almond butter reaches desired texture. Store
in a lidded jar in fridge, 2 weeks.
Note: 
This recipe makes 2 cups. There are 32 tbsp. in 2 cups.
Serving size is based on 2 tbsp. per serving.

meals.name: Mezze Bowls
meals.instruction:
Heat oven 425 F.
Slice zucchini, bell peppers, red onion and delicata squash
into even-sized pieces. Coat baking sheets in olive oil and
arrange vegetables on baking sheets. Place in the oven to
roast- about 15-20 minutes.
Make the hummus dressing by combining hummus, lemon
juice, olive oil, salt and pepper.
Combine chickpeas and hot sauce of choice in a small bowl.
Combine vegetables and chickpeas in a pan and add
spinach just long enough to wilt.
Arrange quinoa, spinach and roasted vegetables in bowls.
Top with chickpeas, hummus dressing and a sprinkling of
cilantro and any herbs of choice.

meals.name: No Bake Pumpkin Spice Energy Bars
meals.instruction:
Place all ingredients in a food processor and pulse until the
mixture is well combined, but there are still some chunks of
nuts. It should look like this picture.
In a parchment paper lined bread pan, spread the mixture
and press it down firmly with a spatula. Pull the whole
mixture out of the pan and cut into bars or bites of your
desired size. Enjoy!

meals.name: Italian Orzo Salad
meals.instruction:
1. Wash and slice the spinach, basil, and mushrooms and
chop sun dried tomatoes. Place in the bottom of a pasta
strainer.
2.
A) If pasta was made ahead of time: Reheat reserved
cooking water in the microwave and pour over the
vegetable in the strainer (this will slightly cook them & add
some starchiness). Continue to step 3.
B) If pasta was not made ahead of time: Cook the orzo
according to package directions. When ready to drain, pour
the whole pot, orzo with water, over the veggies in the
bottom of the pasta strainer (this will slightly cook them &
add some starchiness).
3. Place pasta and vegetables in a big bowl. Add the rest of
the ingredients into the bowl and mix until well combined.
Portion into 4 mason jars and enjoy!
Advanced Preparation
1 - 3 days prior [optional], Orzo, dry 567 gm 
Instructions:
Cook the orzo according to package directions.
Drain, but reserve 1 cup of pasta water. Add 1 tsp
of olive oil to pasta to prevent sticking and store in
an airtight container in the fridge.

ingredients.name:
Water (or more depending on how thick
you like your smoothies)

Preheat oven to 325F and line baking sheet with parchment paper. Place pitas on baking sheet and let them get warm for about 10 minutes. You do not want them too crispy. While the pitas are toasting in the oven, heat up the beans in a small fry pan and add seasonings like salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Leave on the fry pan about 5-6 minutes, just until warm. Mash up 4 avocados. Add seasonings salt, pepper and garlic powder, mix well. Once your pitas are toasty, and the beans are ready you can assemble accordingly. Take a generous spoonful of mashed avocado and spread it across your warm, toasty pita. Throw on about 1/4 to 1/3 cup of beans to each pita. Dollop each pita with a serving of vegan sour cream or hummus. Sprinkle with green onions or scallions, season with salt/ pepper, Enjoy!

meals.name: Green Monster Smoothie
meals.instruction:
1. Place all ingredients of the ingredient into a high powered blender.
2. Start blending slowly increase speed to high. Blend for 45
seconds or until desired consistency is reached.
3. Serve immediately, and enjoy

ingredients.name: Protein Powder, Bulletproof Collagen (which should equal 3 tbsp)
Stevia sweetener, powder (to taste; optional; or xylitol)

meals.name: Keto Chocolate Avocado Mousse
meals.instruction:
1. Chill ripe avocado for 1-2 hours prior.
2. Add avocado to your blender, along with chocolate
and protein powders, followed by the coconut milk.
3. Add sweetener of choice (optional).
4. Put the lid on and blend for 10 seconds then rest for
10 seconds in intervals until mousse reaches silky
consistency.
5. Transfer to bowls and add your favorite toppings!
See "Notes" below.

Notes:
Chilling the avocado assures the blender stays cool, which helps maintain the temperature of your dessert just in case you
want to consume it immediately.
Blending in intervals helps to avoid overheating, which can destroy the protein in the powder as well as the consistency of
the mousse.
Optional toppings
Himalayan Sea Salt

meals.name: Sliced Apples & Almond Butter
meals.instruction:
1. Slice apple and sprinkle slices with cinnamon.
2. Dip in almond butter for a blood sugar balancing snack.
Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Tofu, regular, extra firm (rinsed and drained)

meals.name: High Protein Vegan Breakfast Burrito
meals.instruction:
Press tofu: Rinse the tofu with water and place a couple
kitchen towels on the counter. Wrap the tofu with another
towel, place another towel on top, and finally place several
heavy cookbooks on top. Let sit for at least 20 minutes to
soak out the water. Alternatively, you can use a tofu press if
you have one.
Meanwhile, heat a large skillet with 1 tsp oil over medium
heat. Saut� garlic and onion for a few minutes over medium
heat. Add in the diced potato and mushrooms and saut� for
12 minutes, reducing heat if necessary and stirring
frequently so it does not stick to the bottom.
Remove tofu from towels and dice on chopping board. You
want the tofu very small. Now, reduce heat to low and stir
in the nutritional yeast, tofu, fresh herbs, lemon juice, and
season with salt and pepper to taste.
Continue cooking on low until potato is cooked through,
only a few more minutes, if necessary.
Add 3/4 cup of the mixture on a large tortilla wrap, spoon on
salsa, and top with Daiya cheese and chopped green onion
if desired

meals.name: Cauliflower Mashed Potatoes with Mushroom Gravy
meals.instruction:
In a large saucepan, cover potatoes with water and bring to
a boil. Reduce heat to a low boil and cook until a knife
inserted slides off easily.
In the meantime, add the cauliflower to a strainer or veggie
steamer and place on top of the potatoes in the saucepan
to cook at the same time. Cover with a lid to steam.
Once both are soft and cooked through, transfer to a bowl
and mash with a potato masher, adding salt and pepper
and 1 Tbsp of vegan butter to season. Set aside and cover
to keep warm.
In skillet over medium to medium-high heat, melt the vegan
butter. Add the shallot and mushroom and cook for 10
minutes, stirring frequently. Cook until the mushrooms are
soft and brown, and most of their liquid is evaporated.
Stir in the flour with a whisk and reduce heat to medium.
Cook for another minute or two.
Slowly add veggie broth while whisking to reduce clumps.
Then add in the thyme and whisk again.
Reduce heat to simmer and continue to stir until it reaches
desired thickness � about 5-10 minutes. If it appears too
thin, add a touch more flour and whisk. If it�s too thick, add
more broth.
Season with salt and fresh ground black pepper to taste.
Serve over cauliflower mashed potatoes. Store leftovers in
the fridge in an air-tight container for up to a few days.

meals.name: Blueberry Smoothie Bowl
meals.instruction:
Blend all smoothie ingredients together. Pour into bowls.
Top with fresh fruit, nuts and seeds of your choice. I used
mango, strawberries, banana, blueberries, chia seeds and
granola.
Enjoy!

12 minutes, reducing heat if necessary and stirring
frequently so it does not stick to the bottom.
Remove tofu from towels and dice on chopping board. You
want the tofu very small. Now, reduce heat to low and stir
in the nutritional yeast, tofu, fresh herbs, lemon juice, and
season with salt and pepper to taste.
Continue cooking on low until potato is cooked through,
only a few more minutes, if necessary.
Add 3/4 cup of the mixture on a large tortilla wrap, spoon on
salsa, and top with Daiya cheese and chopped green onion
if desired

meals.name: Tofu Parmigiana (vegan)
meals.instruction:
1. Combine the breadcrumbs, 2 tablespoons of your
Parmesan cheese, a single teaspoon of oregano, and
salt and pepper (to taste) together in a small bowl.
2. Slice the tofu into as close to consistent quarter inch
slices as you can, but don�t worry about being
picture-perfect. Make sure you season the tofu with
a bit of the herbs and spices as well.
3. One by one, press the tofu pieces into your
�breadcrumb mixture�, evenly coating all sides as
you go along. Heat up a bit of oil in a medium-sized
skillet over medium/high heat, and then cook until
one side of the tofu is crispy.
4. When you have a bit of browning going on, drizzle a
bit more olive oil, flip the tofu, and do the same for
each side.
5. Preheat oven to 400�F. Combine tomato sauce, the
basil and garlic, and any remaining bits of oregano
together, placing a little bit of sauce in a baking pan.
Arrange tofu pieces and then spoon the rest of the
sauce over the pieces.
6. Top off with a bit of shredded mozzarella and the last
3 tablespoons of Parmesan. Bake for 20 minutes.

meals.name: Cauliflower Mashed Potatoes with Mushroom Gravy
meals.instruction:
In a large saucepan, cover potatoes with water and bring to
a boil. Reduce heat to a low boil and cook until a knife
inserted slides off easily.
In the meantime, add the cauliflower to a strainer or veggie
steamer and place on top of the potatoes in the saucepan
to cook at the same time. Cover with a lid to steam.
Once both are soft and cooked through, transfer to a bowl
and mash with a potato masher, adding salt and pepper
and 1 Tbsp of vegan butter to season. Set aside and cover
to keep warm.
In skillet over medium to medium-high heat, melt the vegan
butter. Add the shallot and mushroom and cook for 10
minutes, stirring frequently. Cook until the mushrooms are
soft and brown, and most of their liquid is evaporated.
Stir in the flour with a whisk and reduce heat to medium.
Cook for another minute or two.
Slowly add veggie broth while whisking to reduce clumps.
Then add in the thyme and whisk again.
Reduce heat to simmer and continue to stir until it reaches
desired thickness � about 5-10 minutes. If it appears too
thin, add a touch more flour and whisk. If it�s too thick, add
more broth.
Season with salt and fresh ground black pepper to taste.
Serve over cauliflower mashed potatoes. Store leftovers in
the fridge in an air-tight container for up to a few days.

ingredients.name: Chicken breast, boneless, skinless (cut into 1-inch cubes)

meals.name: Keto Grilled Pesto Chicken and Tomato Kebabs
meals.instruction:
1. In a food processor pulse basil, garlic, parmesan
cheese, salt and pepper until smooth. Slowly add the
olive oil while pulsing. Reserve 2-3 tbsp pesto in a
separate bowl.
2. Combine the raw chicken with the rest of the pesto
and marinate a few hours in a bowl.
3. Soak wooden skewers in water at least 30 minutes
(or use metal ones to avoid this step).
4. Beginning and ending with chicken, thread chicken
and tomatoes onto 8 pairs of parallel skewers to
make 8 kebabs total.
5. Heat the outdoor grill or indoor grill pan over
medium heat until hot. Be sure the grates are clean
and spray lightly with oil.
6. Place the chicken on the hot grill and cook about 3-4
minutes. Turn and continue cooking until chicken is
cooked through, about 2 to 3 minutes. Brush with
the reserved pesto.

meals.name: Mezze Bowls
meals.instruction:
Heat oven 425 F.
Slice zucchini, bell peppers, red onion and delicata squash
into even-sized pieces. Coat baking sheets in olive oil and
arrange vegetables on baking sheets. Place in the oven to
roast- about 15-20 minutes.
Make the hummus dressing by combining hummus, lemon
juice, olive oil, salt and pepper.
Combine chickpeas and hot sauce of choice in a small bowl.
Combine vegetables and chickpeas in a pan and add
spinach just long enough to wilt.
Arrange quinoa, spinach and roasted vegetables in bowls.
Top with chickpeas, hummus dressing and a sprinkling of
cilantro and any herbs of choice.

ingredients.name: Sauerkraut (up to 1 tbsp for lunch & dinner to support gut flora & digestion of the food you are eating.)

meals.name: Sauerkraut
meals.instruction: Buy sauerkraut or other fermented veggies that contains only water, sea salt & spices/herbs. NO VINEGAR

meals.name: Brain-Adrenal Balancing Smoothie
meals.instruction:
Combine everything in a blender until smooth.

meals.name: Crazy Bean Chili
meals.instruction:
Toast cumin seeds in dry soup pot on medium heat, for 2 minutes until the aroma is strong. (This process releases the full flavour of
the spice).
Add the olive oil, onion, garlic, and jalape�o. Stir consistently until the onion is golden and translucent.
Add in the chili powder, tempeh (or mushrooms), zucchini, and potato, and stir well. Saut� for 3 to 4 minutes, stirring to avoid
sticking.
Add in black beans, kidney beans, tomatoes, water, maple syrup, sea salt, and cilantro. Cover with a lid, reduce heat to low, and
cook for 20�25 minutes, or until potatoes are tender.
Remove from heat, and stir in the kale. 
Serve hot. Garnish with diced avocado and cilantro, if using.
Enjoy!

meals.name: Italian Orzo Salad
meals.instruction:
1. Wash and slice the spinach, basil, and mushrooms and
chop sun dried tomatoes. Place in the bottom of a pasta
strainer.
2.
A) If pasta was made ahead of time: Reheat reserved
cooking water in the microwave and pour over the
vegetable in the strainer (this will slightly cook them & add
some starchiness). Continue to step 3.
B) If pasta was not made ahead of time: Cook the orzo
according to package directions. When ready to drain, pour
the whole pot, orzo with water, over the veggies in the
bottom of the pasta strainer (this will slightly cook them &
add some starchiness).
3. Place pasta and vegetables in a big bowl. Add the rest of
the ingredients into the bowl and mix until well combined.
Portion into 4 mason jars and enjoy!
Advanced Preparation
1 - 3 days prior [optional], Orzo, dry 567 gm 
Instructions:
Cook the orzo according to package directions.
Drain, but reserve 1 cup of pasta water. Add 1 tsp
of olive oil to pasta to prevent sticking and store in
an airtight container in the fridge.

meals.name: Salmon with Avocado Salsa Oven Baked

don't go in the fish).
Place in the oven and cook until done, about 15-20 minutes
depending on the thickness of the fish.
Avocado Salsa

pinch of sea salt in a bowl and mix well,
Raw onion can be hard to digest. If you are healing
your gut either sautee or steam the onion or leave them

ingredients.name: Protein Powder, Bulletproof Collagen (which should equal 3 tbsp)
Stevia sweetener, powder (to taste; optional; or xylitol)

meals.name: Keto Chocolate Avocado Mousse
meals.instruction:
1. Chill ripe avocado for 1-2 hours prior.
2. Add avocado to your blender, along with chocolate
and protein powders, followed by the coconut milk.
3. Add sweetener of choice (optional).
4. Put the lid on and blend for 10 seconds then rest for
10 seconds in intervals until mousse reaches silky
consistency.
5. Transfer to bowls and add your favorite toppings!
See "Notes" below.

Notes:
Chilling the avocado assures the blender stays cool, which helps maintain the temperature of your dessert just in case you
want to consume it immediately.
Blending in intervals helps to avoid overheating, which can destroy the protein in the powder as well as the consistency of
the mousse.
Optional toppings
Himalayan Sea Salt

ingredients.name: Red currant (or raisins or other dried fruit)

meals.name: Best Lentil Salad Ever
meals.instruction:
1. Rinse lentils well, drain. Place in a pot and cover
with a 3-4 inches of water, bring to a boil, reduce to
simmer. Check lentils for doneness after 15 minutes,
but they should take about 20 minutes in total. You
will know they are cooked if they still retain a slight
tooth � al dente! Overcooking the lentils is the death
of this dish. Be careful!
2. While the lentils are simmering, make the dressing
by placing all ingredients in a jar with a tight fitting
lid and shake vigorously to combine.
3. Finely dice red onion � the salad is best if all the
ingredients are about the same size. If using raisins,
chop them roughly to make them a bit smaller, and
do the same with the capers if they are large.
4. When the lentils are cooked, remove from heat,
drain and place under cold running water to stop the
cooking process. Once cooled slightly, but still a
little warm, place lentils in a large serving bowl and
toss with dressing. Add onion, capers, and currants.

Optional add-ins: arugula, walnuts, goat cheese, fresh
herbs (flat-leaf parsley, cilantro, basil), sprouts, or crispy
seasonal veggies.
If using other add-ins, add them just before serving.

but they should take about 20 minutes in total. You
will know they are cooked if they still retain a slight
tooth � al dente! Overcooking the lentils is the death
of this dish. Be careful!
2. While the lentils are simmering, make the dressing
by placing all ingredients in a jar with a tight fitting
lid and shake vigorously to combine.
3. Finely dice red onion � the salad is best if all the
ingredients are about the same size. If using raisins,
chop them roughly to make them a bit smaller, and
do the same with the capers if they are large.
4. When the lentils are cooked, remove from heat,
drain and place under cold running water to stop the
cooking process. Once cooled slightly, but still a
little warm, place lentils in a large serving bowl and
toss with dressing. Add onion, capers, and currants.

Optional add-ins: arugula, walnuts, goat cheese, fresh
herbs (flat-leaf parsley, cilantro, basil), sprouts, or crispy
seasonal veggies.
If using other add-ins, add them just before serving.

ingredients.name: Atlantic salmon, wild (cut into 6 pieces or 1 large piece)

meals.name: Salmon with Avocado Salsa Oven Baked
meals.instruction:
Pre-heat the oven to 400 degrees.
Mix the cumin, paprika, garlic powder, black pepper, and
a 1/4 pinch of sea salt.
Coat the salmon with olive oil, the seasoning mix, and the
sliced onions.
Next, cover the pan with a glass lid (parchment paper and
then aluminum foil on top, so the toxins from the aluminum
don't go in the fish).
Place in the oven and cook until done, about 15-20 minutes
depending on the thickness of the fish.
Avocado Salsa
Combine the avocado, onion*, cilantro, lime juice, and 1/2
pinch of sea salt in a bowl and mix well,
Raw onion can be hard to digest. If you are healing
your gut either sautee or steam the onion or leave them
out.
Top the cooked salmon with avocado salsa and enjoy!

meals.name: Mezze Bowls
meals.instruction:
Heat oven 425 F.
Slice zucchini, bell peppers, red onion and delicata squash
into even-sized pieces. Coat baking sheets in olive oil and
arrange vegetables on baking sheets. Place in the oven to
roast- about 15-20 minutes.
Make the hummus dressing by combining hummus, lemon
juice, olive oil, salt and pepper.
Combine chickpeas and hot sauce of choice in a small bowl.
Combine vegetables and chickpeas in a pan and add
spinach just long enough to wilt.
Arrange quinoa, spinach and roasted vegetables in bowls.
Top with chickpeas, hummus dressing and a sprinkling of
cilantro and any herbs of choice.

meals.name: Mezze Bowls
meals.instruction:
Heat oven 425 F.
Slice zucchini, bell peppers, red onion and delicata squash
into even-sized pieces. Coat baking sheets in olive oil and
arrange vegetables on baking sheets. Place in the oven to
roast- about 15-20 minutes.
Make the hummus dressing by combining hummus, lemon
juice, olive oil, salt and pepper.
Combine chickpeas and hot sauce of choice in a small bowl.
Combine vegetables and chickpeas in a pan and add
spinach just long enough to wilt.
Arrange quinoa, spinach and roasted vegetables in bowls.
Top with chickpeas, hummus dressing and a sprinkling of
cilantro and any herbs of choice.

meals.name: Toasted Avocado & Bean Pitas
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 325F and line baking sheet with parchment
paper.
Place pitas on baking sheet and let them get warm for
about 10 minutes. You do not want them too crispy.
While the pitas are toasting in the oven, heat up the beans
in a small fry pan and add seasonings like salt, pepper, and
garlic powder. Leave on the fry pan about 5-6 minutes, just
until warm.
Mash up 4 avocados. Add seasonings salt, pepper and garlic
powder, mix well.
Once your pitas are toasty, and the beans are ready you
can assemble accordingly.
Take a generous spoonful of mashed avocado and spread it
across your warm, toasty pita. Throw on about 1/4 to 1/3
cup of beans to each pita. 
Dollop each pita with a serving of vegan sour cream or
hummus.
Sprinkle with green onions or scallions, season with salt/
pepper,
Enjoy!

meals.name: Sliced Apples & Almond Butter
meals.instruction:
1. Slice apple and sprinkle slices with cinnamon.
2. Dip in almond butter for a blood sugar balancing snack.
Enjoy!

meals.name: Avocado & Hummus Topped Rice Cakes
meals.instruction:
Spread hummus over 4 cakes
Divide avocado in half by running a sharp knife around the
outside (length-wise) and remove the pit
Scoop avocado out and slice thinly placing equal amounts
on each rice cake
Sprinkle with fresh basil and serve

meals.name: Cauliflower Mashed Potatoes with Mushroom Gravy
meals.instruction:
In a large saucepan, cover potatoes with water and bring to
a boil. Reduce heat to a low boil and cook until a knife
inserted slides off easily.
In the meantime, add the cauliflower to a strainer or veggie
steamer and place on top of the potatoes in the saucepan
to cook at the same time. Cover with a lid to steam.
Once both are soft and cooked through, transfer to a bowl
and mash with a potato masher, adding salt and pepper
and 1 Tbsp of vegan butter to season. Set aside and cover
to keep warm.
In skillet over medium to medium-high heat, melt the vegan
butter. Add the shallot and mushroom and cook for 10
minutes, stirring frequently. Cook until the mushrooms are
soft and brown, and most of their liquid is evaporated.
Stir in the flour with a whisk and reduce heat to medium.
Cook for another minute or two.
Slowly add veggie broth while whisking to reduce clumps.
Then add in the thyme and whisk again.
Reduce heat to simmer and continue to stir until it reaches
desired thickness � about 5-10 minutes. If it appears too
thin, add a touch more flour and whisk. If it�s too thick, add
more broth.
Season with salt and fresh ground black pepper to taste.
Serve over cauliflower mashed potatoes. Store leftovers in
the fridge in an air-tight container for up to a few days.

meals.name: Crazy Bean Chili
meals.instruction:
Toast cumin seeds in dry soup pot on medium heat, for 2 minutes until the aroma is strong. (This process releases the full flavour of
the spice).
Add the olive oil, onion, garlic, and jalape�o. Stir consistently until the onion is golden and translucent.
Add in the chili powder, tempeh (or mushrooms), zucchini, and potato, and stir well. Saut� for 3 to 4 minutes, stirring to avoid
sticking.
Add in black beans, kidney beans, tomatoes, water, maple syrup, sea salt, and cilantro. Cover with a lid, reduce heat to low, and
cook for 20�25 minutes, or until potatoes are tender.
Remove from heat, and stir in the kale. 
Serve hot. Garnish with diced avocado and cilantro, if using.
Enjoy!

meals.name: Tofu Parmigiana (vegan)
meals.instruction:
1. Combine the breadcrumbs, 2 tablespoons of your
Parmesan cheese, a single teaspoon of oregano, and
salt and pepper (to taste) together in a small bowl.
2. Slice the tofu into as close to consistent quarter inch
slices as you can, but don�t worry about being
picture-perfect. Make sure you season the tofu with
a bit of the herbs and spices as well.
3. One by one, press the tofu pieces into your
�breadcrumb mixture�, evenly coating all sides as
you go along. Heat up a bit of oil in a medium-sized
skillet over medium/high heat, and then cook until
one side of the tofu is crispy.
4. When you have a bit of browning going on, drizzle a
bit more olive oil, flip the tofu, and do the same for
each side.
5. Preheat oven to 400�F. Combine tomato sauce, the
basil and garlic, and any remaining bits of oregano
together, placing a little bit of sauce in a baking pan.
Arrange tofu pieces and then spoon the rest of the
sauce over the pieces.
6. Top off with a bit of shredded mozzarella and the last
3 tablespoons of Parmesan. Bake for 20 minutes.

meals.name: Gluten-Free Avocado Toast
meals.instruction:
Toast bread slices. Slice a ripe avocado in half. 
Squeeze the meat of the avocado onto the toasted bread
and spread it evenly.
Cut a lime in half and gently squeeze the juice over the
avocado on your slices of toast.
Sprinkle red pepper flakes, sea salt, and black pepper to
taste.
Enjoy!

meals.name: Green Beans with Walnuts and Onions
meals.instruction:
Cut off green beans ends, boil green beans 3-4 minutes. 
In a large skillet, heat half of the olive oil over medium heat
and cook onions, stirring, for 5 minutes. Add walnuts and
garlic and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes.
Add the remaining oil and green beans. Season with salt
and pepper, stir and cook for 2 minutes.
Serve as an appetizer or with parboiled rice to make a
complete meal.

bowl with all the other nuts, seeds, and coconut flakes.
Combine melted coconut oil, maple syrup, vanilla extract,
and cinnamon. Pour into the dry ingredients and mix until
everything is well-coated.
Place in the oven to cook for 30 minutes.

meals.name: Keto Grilled Pesto Chicken and Tomato Kebabs
meals.instruction:
1. In a food processor pulse basil, garlic, parmesan
cheese, salt and pepper until smooth. Slowly add the
olive oil while pulsing. Reserve 2-3 tbsp pesto in a
separate bowl.
2. Combine the raw chicken with the rest of the pesto
and marinate a few hours in a bowl.
3. Soak wooden skewers in water at least 30 minutes
(or use metal ones to avoid this step).
4. Beginning and ending with chicken, thread chicken
and tomatoes onto 8 pairs of parallel skewers to
make 8 kebabs total.
5. Heat the outdoor grill or indoor grill pan over
medium heat until hot. Be sure the grates are clean
and spray lightly with oil.
6. Place the chicken on the hot grill and cook about 3-4
minutes. Turn and continue cooking until chicken is
cooked through, about 2 to 3 minutes. Brush with
the reserved pesto.

meals.name: Smoked Paprika & Turmeric Roast Chicken Thighs
meals.instruction:
Make marinade: Add olive oil, lime juice, ginger, turmeric,
garlic, smoked paprika, salt and sumac and whisk until
everything is combined.
Wash chicken and pat dry and put in a Ziploc bag, add all of
the marinade, close bag and massage until every piece of
chicken is covered with the marinade. Put chicken in the
fridge and let marinate for at least 24 hours.
Next day:
Pre-heat oven to 350�F and line a deep baking dish with
parchment paper. Pour the chicken plus marinade into the
baking sheet and bake for 2 hours
uncovered. When cooked remove from baking dish and put
on a serving platter, drizzle some of the pan juices on the
chicken thighs & and serve with your side of choice such as
Quinoa OR Rice�..YUMMY

meals.name: Omega-3 Maple Almond Butter
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees and line a baking sheet with
parchment paper.
Toss almonds with maple syrup, to coat, and spread in an
even layer on lined baking sheet.
Roast in oven 10 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool.
Place roasted almonds, flax, chia, and hemp seeds in the
bowl of a food processor and process until smooth and the
oils have released. Add in coconut oil, cinnamon, and salt.
Process until almond butter reaches desired texture. Store
in a lidded jar in fridge, 2 weeks.
Note: 
This recipe makes 2 cups. There are 32 tbsp. in 2 cups.
Serving size is based on 2 tbsp. per serving.

Optional add-ins: arugula, walnuts, goat cheese, fresh
herbs (flat-leaf parsley, cilantro, basil), sprouts, or crispy
seasonal veggies.
If using other add-ins, add them just before serving.

ingredients.name: Red currant (or raisins or other dried fruit)

meals.name: Best Lentil Salad Ever
meals.instruction:
1. Rinse lentils well, drain. Place in a pot and cover
with a 3-4 inches of water, bring to a boil, reduce to
simmer. Check lentils for doneness after 15 minutes,
but they should take about 20 minutes in total. You
will know they are cooked if they still retain a slight
tooth � al dente! Overcooking the lentils is the death
of this dish. Be careful!
2. While the lentils are simmering, make the dressing
by placing all ingredients in a jar with a tight fitting
lid and shake vigorously to combine.
3. Finely dice red onion � the salad is best if all the
ingredients are about the same size. If using raisins,
chop them roughly to make them a bit smaller, and
do the same with the capers if they are large.
4. When the lentils are cooked, remove from heat,
drain and place under cold running water to stop the
cooking process. Once cooled slightly, but still a
little warm, place lentils in a large serving bowl and
toss with dressing. Add onion, capers, and currants.

Optional add-ins: arugula, walnuts, goat cheese, fresh
herbs (flat-leaf parsley, cilantro, basil), sprouts, or crispy
seasonal veggies.
If using other add-ins, add them just before serving.

ingredients.name: Chicken breast, boneless, skinless (cut into 1-inch cubes)

meals.name: Keto Grilled Pesto Chicken and Tomato Kebabs
meals.instruction:
1. In a food processor pulse basil, garlic, parmesan
cheese, salt and pepper until smooth. Slowly add the
olive oil while pulsing. Reserve 2-3 tbsp pesto in a
separate bowl.
2. Combine the raw chicken with the rest of the pesto
and marinate a few hours in a bowl.
3. Soak wooden skewers in water at least 30 minutes
(or use metal ones to avoid this step).
4. Beginning and ending with chicken, thread chicken
and tomatoes onto 8 pairs of parallel skewers to
make 8 kebabs total.
5. Heat the outdoor grill or indoor grill pan over
medium heat until hot. Be sure the grates are clean
and spray lightly with oil.
6. Place the chicken on the hot grill and cook about 3-4
minutes. Turn and continue cooking until chicken is
cooked through, about 2 to 3 minutes. Brush with
the reserved pesto.

meals.name: Crazy Bean Chili
meals.instruction:
Toast cumin seeds in dry soup pot on medium heat, for 2 minutes until the aroma is strong. (This process releases the full flavour of
the spice).
Add the olive oil, onion, garlic, and jalape�o. Stir consistently until the onion is golden and translucent.
Add in the chili powder, tempeh (or mushrooms), zucchini, and potato, and stir well. Saut� for 3 to 4 minutes, stirring to avoid
sticking.
Add in black beans, kidney beans, tomatoes, water, maple syrup, sea salt, and cilantro. Cover with a lid, reduce heat to low, and
cook for 20�25 minutes, or until potatoes are tender.
Remove from heat, and stir in the kale. 
Serve hot. Garnish with diced avocado and cilantro, if using.
Enjoy!

ingredients.name: Atlantic salmon, wild (cut into 6 pieces or 1 large piece)

meals.name: Salmon with Avocado Salsa Oven Baked
meals.instruction:
Pre-heat the oven to 400 degrees.
Mix the cumin, paprika, garlic powder, black pepper, and
a 1/4 pinch of sea salt.
Coat the salmon with olive oil, the seasoning mix, and the
sliced onions.
Next, cover the pan with a glass lid (parchment paper and
then aluminum foil on top, so the toxins from the aluminum
don't go in the fish).
Place in the oven and cook until done, about 15-20 minutes
depending on the thickness of the fish.
Avocado Salsa
Combine the avocado, onion*, cilantro, lime juice, and 1/2
pinch of sea salt in a bowl and mix well,
Raw onion can be hard to digest. If you are healing
your gut either sautee or steam the onion or leave them
out.
Top the cooked salmon with avocado salsa and enjoy!

ingredients.name: Sauerkraut (up to 1 tbsp for lunch & dinner to support gut flora & digestion of the food you are eating.)

meals.name: Sauerkraut
meals.instruction: Buy sauerkraut or other fermented veggies that contains only water, sea salt & spices/herbs. NO VINEGAR

meals.name: Hormone Balancing Granola
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 180�F.
Chop Brazil nuts and pecans in a food processor. Mix in a
bowl with all the other nuts, seeds, and coconut flakes.
Combine melted coconut oil, maple syrup, vanilla extract,
and cinnamon. Pour into the dry ingredients and mix until
everything is well-coated.
Place in the oven to cook for 30 minutes.

ingredients.name: Maple syrup (or sweetener of your choice)

meals.name: Chia Fresca
meals.instruction:
Place chia and water in a large mason and shake vigorously.
Add remaining ingredients and shake again. Let sit for 10
min. Shake vigorously again to remove any clumps (this is
normal) and enjoy! 
Pro tip: with stress comes inflammation in the body. This
can aggravate fatigue and cause aches and pains. Try
adding a scoop of clean bone broth protein OR collagen
peptides to your Chia water. It is flavorless and a potent
anti-inflammatory. Superfoods for the win!

meals.name: Italian Orzo Salad
meals.instruction:
1. Wash and slice the spinach, basil, and mushrooms and
chop sun dried tomatoes. Place in the bottom of a pasta
strainer.
2.
A) If pasta was made ahead of time: Reheat reserved
cooking water in the microwave and pour over the
vegetable in the strainer (this will slightly cook them & add
some starchiness). Continue to step 3.
B) If pasta was not made ahead of time: Cook the orzo
according to package directions. When ready to drain, pour
the whole pot, orzo with water, over the veggies in the
bottom of the pasta strainer (this will slightly cook them &
add some starchiness).
3. Place pasta and vegetables in a big bowl. Add the rest of
the ingredients into the bowl and mix until well combined.
Portion into 4 mason jars and enjoy!
Advanced Preparation
1 - 3 days prior [optional], Orzo, dry 567 gm 
Instructions:
Cook the orzo according to package directions.
Drain, but reserve 1 cup of pasta water. Add 1 tsp
of olive oil to pasta to prevent sticking and store in
an airtight container in the fridge.

meals.name: No Bake Pumpkin Spice Energy Bars
meals.instruction:
Place all ingredients in a food processor and pulse until the
mixture is well combined, but there are still some chunks of
nuts. It should look like this picture.
In a parchment paper lined bread pan, spread the mixture
and press it down firmly with a spatula. Pull the whole
mixture out of the pan and cut into bars or bites of your
desired size. Enjoy!

spinach just long enough to wilt.
Arrange quinoa, spinach and roasted vegetables in bowls.
Top with chickpeas, hummus dressing and a sprinkling of
cilantro and any herbs of choice.

meals.name: Smoked Paprika & Turmeric Roast Chicken Thighs
meals.instruction:
Make marinade: Add olive oil, lime juice, ginger, turmeric,
garlic, smoked paprika, salt and sumac and whisk until
everything is combined.
Wash chicken and pat dry and put in a Ziploc bag, add all of
the marinade, close bag and massage until every piece of
chicken is covered with the marinade. Put chicken in the
fridge and let marinate for at least 24 hours.
Next day:
Pre-heat oven to 350�F and line a deep baking dish with
parchment paper. Pour the chicken plus marinade into the
baking sheet and bake for 2 hours
uncovered. When cooked remove from baking dish and put
on a serving platter, drizzle some of the pan juices on the
chicken thighs & and serve with your side of choice such as
Quinoa OR Rice�..YUMMY

meals.name: Cauliflower Mashed Potatoes with Mushroom Gravy
meals.instruction:
In a large saucepan, cover potatoes with water and bring to
a boil. Reduce heat to a low boil and cook until a knife
inserted slides off easily.
In the meantime, add the cauliflower to a strainer or veggie
steamer and place on top of the potatoes in the saucepan
to cook at the same time. Cover with a lid to steam.
Once both are soft and cooked through, transfer to a bowl
and mash with a potato masher, adding salt and pepper
and 1 Tbsp of vegan butter to season. Set aside and cover
to keep warm.
In skillet over medium to medium-high heat, melt the vegan
butter. Add the shallot and mushroom and cook for 10
minutes, stirring frequently. Cook until the mushrooms are
soft and brown, and most of their liquid is evaporated.
Stir in the flour with a whisk and reduce heat to medium.
Cook for another minute or two.
Slowly add veggie broth while whisking to reduce clumps.
Then add in the thyme and whisk again.
Reduce heat to simmer and continue to stir until it reaches
desired thickness � about 5-10 minutes. If it appears too
thin, add a touch more flour and whisk. If it�s too thick, add
more broth.
Season with salt and fresh ground black pepper to taste.
Serve over cauliflower mashed potatoes. Store leftovers in
the fridge in an air-tight container for up to a few days.

ingredients.name: Sauerkraut (up to 1 tbsp for lunch & dinner to support gut flora & digestion of the food you are eating.)

meals.name: Sauerkraut
meals.instruction: Buy sauerkraut or other fermented veggies that contains only water, sea salt & spices/herbs. NO VINEGAR

meals.name: Tofu Parmigiana (vegan)
meals.instruction:
1. Combine the breadcrumbs, 2 tablespoons of your
Parmesan cheese, a single teaspoon of oregano, and
salt and pepper (to taste) together in a small bowl.
2. Slice the tofu into as close to consistent quarter inch
slices as you can, but don�t worry about being
picture-perfect. Make sure you season the tofu with
a bit of the herbs and spices as well.
3. One by one, press the tofu pieces into your
�breadcrumb mixture�, evenly coating all sides as
you go along. Heat up a bit of oil in a medium-sized
skillet over medium/high heat, and then cook until
one side of the tofu is crispy.
4. When you have a bit of browning going on, drizzle a
bit more olive oil, flip the tofu, and do the same for
each side.
5. Preheat oven to 400�F. Combine tomato sauce, the
basil and garlic, and any remaining bits of oregano
together, placing a little bit of sauce in a baking pan.
Arrange tofu pieces and then spoon the rest of the
sauce over the pieces.
6. Top off with a bit of shredded mozzarella and the last
3 tablespoons of Parmesan. Bake for 20 minutes.

meals.name: Gluten-Free Avocado Toast
meals.instruction:
Toast bread slices. Slice a ripe avocado in half. 
Squeeze the meat of the avocado onto the toasted bread
and spread it evenly.
Cut a lime in half and gently squeeze the juice over the
avocado on your slices of toast.
Sprinkle red pepper flakes, sea salt, and black pepper to
taste.
Enjoy!

meals.name: Blueberry Smoothie Bowl
meals.instruction:
Blend all smoothie ingredients together. Pour into bowls.
Top with fresh fruit, nuts and seeds of your choice. I used
mango, strawberries, banana, blueberries, chia seeds and
granola.
Enjoy!

Scoop avocado out and slice thinly placing equal amounts
on each rice cake
Sprinkle with fresh basil and serve

meals.name: Omega-3 Maple Almond Butter
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees and line a baking sheet with
parchment paper.
Toss almonds with maple syrup, to coat, and spread in an
even layer on lined baking sheet.
Roast in oven 10 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool.
Place roasted almonds, flax, chia, and hemp seeds in the
bowl of a food processor and process until smooth and the
oils have released. Add in coconut oil, cinnamon, and salt.
Process until almond butter reaches desired texture. Store
in a lidded jar in fridge, 2 weeks.
Note: 
This recipe makes 2 cups. There are 32 tbsp. in 2 cups.
Serving size is based on 2 tbsp. per serving.

meals.name: Overnight PB&J Oats
meals.instruction:
In a small canning jar (or glass container with a lid), mix the
oats, almond milk, peanut butter and chia seeds until well
combined. Gently stir in strawberries. Cover and refrigerate
overnight.
Top with 1-2 tablespoons of almond milk before eating if you
like a looser consistency.
Note:
Oats are a great source of dietary fiber, potassium and iron.
If you haven�t given overnight oats a try yet, you are
missing out. This oatmeal is super satisfying and
reminiscent of a peanut butter and jelly sandwich.

Stevia sweetener, powder (to taste; optional; or xylitol)

meals.name: Keto Chocolate Avocado Mousse
meals.instruction:
1. Chill ripe avocado for 1-2 hours prior.
2. Add avocado to your blender, along with chocolate
and protein powders, followed by the coconut milk.
3. Add sweetener of choice (optional).
4. Put the lid on and blend for 10 seconds then rest for
10 seconds in intervals until mousse reaches silky
consistency.
5. Transfer to bowls and add your favorite toppings!
See "Notes" below.

Notes:
Chilling the avocado assures the blender stays cool, which helps maintain the temperature of your dessert just in case you
want to consume it immediately.
Blending in intervals helps to avoid overheating, which can destroy the protein in the powder as well as the consistency of
the mousse.
Optional toppings
Himalayan Sea Salt

Parmesan cheese, a single teaspoon of oregano, and
salt and pepper (to taste) together in a small bowl.
2. Slice the tofu into as close to consistent quarter inch
slices as you can, but don�t worry about being
picture-perfect. Make sure you season the tofu with
a bit of the herbs and spices as well.
3. One by one, press the tofu pieces into your
�breadcrumb mixture�, evenly coating all sides as
you go along. Heat up a bit of oil in a medium-sized
skillet over medium/high heat, and then cook until
one side of the tofu is crispy.
4. When you have a bit of browning going on, drizzle a
bit more olive oil, flip the tofu, and do the same for
each side.
5. Preheat oven to 400�F. Combine tomato sauce, the
basil and garlic, and any remaining bits of oregano
together, placing a little bit of sauce in a baking pan.
Arrange tofu pieces and then spoon the rest of the
sauce over the pieces.
6. Top off with a bit of shredded mozzarella and the last
3 tablespoons of Parmesan. Bake for 20 minutes.

meals.name: Avocado & Hummus Topped Rice Cakes
meals.instruction:
Spread hummus over 4 cakes
Divide avocado in half by running a sharp knife around the
outside (length-wise) and remove the pit
Scoop avocado out and slice thinly placing equal amounts
on each rice cake
Sprinkle with fresh basil and serve

ingredients.name: Tofu, regular, extra firm (rinsed and drained)

meals.name: High Protein Vegan Breakfast Burrito
meals.instruction:
Press tofu: Rinse the tofu with water and place a couple
kitchen towels on the counter. Wrap the tofu with another
towel, place another towel on top, and finally place several
heavy cookbooks on top. Let sit for at least 20 minutes to
soak out the water. Alternatively, you can use a tofu press if
you have one.
Meanwhile, heat a large skillet with 1 tsp oil over medium
heat. Saut� garlic and onion for a few minutes over medium
heat. Add in the diced potato and mushrooms and saut� for
12 minutes, reducing heat if necessary and stirring
frequently so it does not stick to the bottom.
Remove tofu from towels and dice on chopping board. You
want the tofu very small. Now, reduce heat to low and stir
in the nutritional yeast, tofu, fresh herbs, lemon juice, and
season with salt and pepper to taste.
Continue cooking on low until potato is cooked through,
only a few more minutes, if necessary.
Add 3/4 cup of the mixture on a large tortilla wrap, spoon on
salsa, and top with Daiya cheese and chopped green onion
if desired

meals.name: Omega-3 Maple Almond Butter
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees and line a baking sheet with
parchment paper.
Toss almonds with maple syrup, to coat, and spread in an
even layer on lined baking sheet.
Roast in oven 10 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool.
Place roasted almonds, flax, chia, and hemp seeds in the
bowl of a food processor and process until smooth and the
oils have released. Add in coconut oil, cinnamon, and salt.
Process until almond butter reaches desired texture. Store
in a lidded jar in fridge, 2 weeks.
Note: 
This recipe makes 2 cups. There are 32 tbsp. in 2 cups.
Serving size is based on 2 tbsp. per serving.

meals.name: Green Beans with Walnuts and Onions
meals.instruction:
Cut off green beans ends, boil green beans 3-4 minutes. 
In a large skillet, heat half of the olive oil over medium heat
and cook onions, stirring, for 5 minutes. Add walnuts and
garlic and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes.
Add the remaining oil and green beans. Season with salt
and pepper, stir and cook for 2 minutes.
Serve as an appetizer or with parboiled rice to make a
complete meal.

ingredients.name: Preheat oven to 325F and line baking sheet with parchment paper. Place pitas on baking sheet and let them get warm for about 10 minutes. You do not want them too crispy. While the pitas are toasting in the oven, heat up the beans in a small fry pan and add seasonings like salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Leave on the fry pan about 5-6 minutes, just until warm. Mash up 4 avocados. Add seasonings salt, pepper and garlic powder, mix well. Once your pitas are toasty, and the beans are ready you can assemble accordingly. Take a generous spoonful of mashed avocado and spread it across your warm, toasty pita. Throw on about 1/4 to 1/3 cup of beans to each pita. Dollop each pita with a serving of vegan sour cream or hummus. Sprinkle with green onions or scallions, season with salt/ pepper, Enjoy!

meals.name: Toasted Avocado & Bean Pitas
meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 325F and line baking sheet with parchment
paper.
Place pitas on baking sheet and let them get warm for
about 10 minutes. You do not want them too crispy.
While the pitas are toasting in the oven, heat up the beans
in a small fry pan and add seasonings like salt, pepper, and
garlic powder. Leave on the fry pan about 5-6 minutes, just
until warm.
Mash up 4 avocados. Add seasonings salt, pepper and garlic
powder, mix well.
Once your pitas are toasty, and the beans are ready you
can assemble accordingly.
Take a generous spoonful of mashed avocado and spread it
across your warm, toasty pita. Throw on about 1/4 to 1/3
cup of beans to each pita. 
Dollop each pita with a serving of vegan sour cream or
hummus.
Sprinkle with green onions or scallions, season with salt/
pepper,
Enjoy!

meals.name: Blueberry Smoothie Bowl
meals.instruction:
Blend all smoothie ingredients together. Pour into bowls.
Top with fresh fruit, nuts and seeds of your choice. I used
mango, strawberries, banana, blueberries, chia seeds and
granola.
Enjoy!

meals.name: Brain-Adrenal Balancing Smoothie
meals.instruction:
Combine everything in a blender until smooth.
Serve and enjoy

meals.name: Protein Parfait
meals.instruction: Combine ingredients, topping with berries. Serve and enjoy!
